clinical_study.brief_title: Ion Channel Genetic Biomarkers: Diagnostic Capabilities in the Assessment of Bipolar Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Ion Channel Genetic Biomarkers: Diagnostic Capabilities in the Assessment of Bipolar Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: Genotype 164 adults to evaluate six selected single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) (rs1006737, rs10994336, rs10994133, rs2238071, rs1051375, rs1024582) for use as a genetic biomarker to differentiate between bipolar depression and unipolar depression.

detailed_description.textblock: Adults ages 18-80 will be recruited if they are diagnosed with bipolar disorder, major depression, or have no mood symptoms. The adults will undergo a diagnostic interview, the Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview (MINI) for the diagnosis. The subjects will also complete the Adverse Childhood Events Scale to evaluate for a genetic x environmental interaction in detecting bipolar disorder at initial assessment. Genotyping will be done by SNaPshot genotyping method and genetic sample will be collected via buccal swab.

primary_outcome.description: Logistic regression will be used to examine a genetic risk score using a risk allele count as the independent variable, with a diagnosis of BD versus MDD versus those with no mood diagnosis as the dependent variable.

secondary_outcome.description: Genetic risk score of selected SNPsrs1006737, rs10994336, rs10994133, rs2238071, rs1051375, rs1024582
Positive family history of bipolar disorder in a first degree relative
0-10 item scale assessing for adversity experienced during childhood

arm_group.description: Diagnosed as having at least 1 lifetime manic episode by the MINI
Diagnosed as having at least 1 Major Depressive Episode by the MINI
Does not meet Criteria for any mood disorder diagnosis (MDD, BD, dysthymia)

biospec_descr.textblock: Buccal Swab collect with genotyping done by SNaPshot.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- presenting to one of 4 Denver Metro Area clinics
- Subjects must fall into one of 3 diagnostic categories, bipolar, MDD, or no mood symptoms.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to provide informed consent
- history of TBI
- history of untreated seizure disorder
- substance abuse in the last 8 hours
- moderate-severe substance abuse disorder diagnosed in the last 6 months
